alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Howard (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:50AM EST until February 18 at 6:41PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following creeks in Indiana... Sugar Creek near Edinburgh Youngs Creek at Amity Mill Creek near Cataract Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville Wildcat Creek near Jerome and at Kokomo .Brief flooding is expected to continue through much of the day for many of the smaller creeks across central Indiana. The most severe flooding will be at Amity where flooding within a foot of moderate flood stage is ongoing and will continue. Other sites will generally remain within a foot or two feet of flood stage and have either crested or nearly crested. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wildcat Creek at Kokomo. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Wildcat creek at flood stage. Water begins to overflow in local parks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EST Friday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 9.5 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this morning by around 1100 AM EST.
